meanings.definition: A person or thing that produces saliva.
meanings.sent1: The salivator in my mouth helps me chew and swallow food.
meanings.sent2: The baby's salivator was working overtime while teething.
meanings.sent3: The dog's excitement for dinner turned him into a salivator machine.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking was so delicious that it turned everyone into salivators.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the juicy burger was a powerful salivator for the hungry crowd.

meanings.definition: A device or substance that stimulates the production of saliva.
meanings.sent1: The dentist used a special salivator to keep my mouth moist during the procedure.
meanings.sent2: Chewing gum can act as a salivator, especially for people with dry mouth.
meanings.sent3: The sour candy was an unexpected salivator during the movie.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh bread was a natural salivator for the bakery customers.
meanings.sent5: The chef added a secret ingredient to the dish to act as a flavor salivator.
